author: Raja Abdulrahim
title: Syria Airstrikes Hit Hospitals in Rebel Territory
text:
BEIRUTâ€”Two hospitals were bombed out of service and several others damaged in 24 hours of airstrikes on an already hard-hit area of Syria, as the last pockets of rebel resistance in the long-running war find themselves increasingly cornered.
The attacks on the northwest province of Idlib, the last opposition stronghold in Syria, included a chlorine chemical attack on Sunday night on the town of Saraqeb that wounded more than a dozen people, according to local activists and rescue workers.
